title: A Valentine’s Day Launch for the Next U.S. Moon Mission
summary: Launch service provider SpaceX said today the first Intuitive Machines mission to the Moon is scheduled for launch on Valentine’s Day, February 14. Intuitive Machines is one of several companies […]

title: NASA’s PACE Climate Sat Ready to Fly
summary: After nearly nine years of planning, preparation, and even once being slated for cancellation entirely, NASA’s Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem (PACE) Earth-observation mission is set for launch. Initially conceived in 2015, PACE will finally reach orbit and begin its planned  3-10 year mission on a launch currently slated for February 6, 2024 at 1:33 AM.

title: The last vestige of old space architectural thinking
summary: Despite the recent explosive increase in launch cadence, ground systems tend to be outdated, underfunded, and overlooked.

title: HyImpulse Are All Packed and Heading Down Under
summary:
German launch startup HyImpulse has confirmed that its SR75 rocket and all related support systems have been boxed up and have embarked on the long journey to Australia. SR75 is a single-stage suborbital launch vehicle that is designed to be capable of delivering up to 250 kilograms to a maximum altitude of around 200 kilometres. […]
The post HyImpulse Are All Packed and Heading Down Under appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA compiling lessons learned from Artemis 1
summary: NASA is wrapping up an effort to collect lessons learned from the Artemis 1 mission that address both technical and programmatic issues that the agency hopes to apply more broadly to the overall Artemis lunar exploration campaign.
